#BTC Price Analysis# #Macro Insights#

Corporate Bitcoin treasury giant Strategy Inc., led by Michael Saylor, has made its largest Bitcoin purchase since July 2025, acquiring 13,627 BTC ($1.25 billion) at an average price of about $91,519 per coin. This brings Strategy‚Äôs total holdings to around 687,410 $BTC , making it one of the largest institutional holders of Bitcoin globally.  This move is notable for a few reasons: ‚Ä¢ It‚Äôs Strategy‚Äôs largest single BTC acquisition in nearly six months, exceeding other recent buys in scale. ‚Ä¢ The purchase occurred while BTC has been trading near the $90,000 level, showing conviction even amid sideways or corrective price action. ‚Ä¢ Despite short-term paper losses on the latest tranche (since BTC has traded slightly below the average buy price), Strategy‚Äôs overall position remains deeply profitable on its cumulative stack.  Historically, Saylor‚Äôs Bitcoin purchases have often preceded notable price moves, with his public hints and chart posts frequently signaling accumulation ahead of broader market interest. While past performance doesn‚Äôt guarantee future outcomes, the size and timing of this buy suggest Strategy may be positioning for what it anticipates to be strengthening Bitcoin demand in the months ahead.  In short, the $1.25B $BTC  buy isn‚Äôt just another accumulation it‚Äôs the largest in half a year, occurring during a region where many traders are cautious. That makes it a meaningful signal that a major institutional player believes the next leg of the Bitcoin rally could be coming, even if markets haven‚Äôt priced it in yet. #BTC Price Analysis#  #Macro Insights#  #BTC  #Saylor

#StandardChartered is in early talks via its #SC Ventures arm to launch a crypto prime brokerage offering financing, securities lending, and custody for institutional traders. The move builds on its July 2025 launch of spot Bitcoin and Ether trading the first by a major global bank and a recent partnership with Coinbase to expand services. As regulations ease, Wall Street‚Äôs crypto push could unlock deeper liquidity and drive more institutional capital into digital assets like  $BTC, accelerating market maturity and adoption across global markets. #BingX

Strategy‚Äôs largest $BTC purchase since July has reignited the classic debate: timing the next rally or simply executing a long-term accumulation strategy.


Historically, Michael Saylor has followed a consistent thesis ‚Äî Bitcoin as a long-term store of value, independent of short-term price action. His previous buys have often occurred during periods of market uncertainty, not necessarily right before immediate breakouts.


Institutional accumulation, however, does not guarantee short-term upside. ETF flows, macro liquidity, interest rate expectations, and overall risk sentiment still dominate Bitcoin‚Äôs near-term direction. Large buys can support confidence, but they do not replace market structure.


This move may be less about front-running a rally and more about reinforcing a multi-year conviction strategy.


In Bitcoin, timing the market matters less than surviving long enough to benefit from it.

CLARITY Bill and Bitcoin‚Äôs Structural Shift ‚Äî On-Chain Signals of Institutionalization via @cryptoquant_com„ÄÄ(Analysis Report No. 177)

The U.S. Senate Banking Committee is set to mark up the crypto market structure bill known as the CLARITY Act on January 15, 2026. This event should be seen less as a short-term price catalyst and more as a potential turning point in how Bitcoin is positioned within the U.S. regulatory system. While prices remain relatively stable, on-chain data already suggests a shift in market behavior.

Exchange Netflow is a key signal. In periods of regulatory uncertainty, Bitcoin typically flows into exchanges as investors prepare to sell. Ahead of the CLARITY bill discussions, however, such inflows have remained limited. This indicates that market participants are not treating the legislative process as an immediate risk event requiring de-risking.

SOPR (Spent Output Profit Ratio) reinforces this view. SOPR, which measures whether moved coins are sold at a profit or loss, is hovering around or slightly below 1. This shows that profit-taking is subdued. More importantly, it suggests that on-chain spending itself is low‚ÄîBitcoin simply is not being moved.

Together, these indicators point to a market that is not defensive, but patient. Rather than rotating positions, investors appear to be holding Bitcoin while waiting for regulatory clarity. The time horizon is lengthening.

The CLARITY Act represents more than policy debate. It is a potential milestone in integrating Bitcoin into the U.S. financial framework as a regulated digital commodity. On-chain data already reflects this transition: before any major price move, Bitcoin is becoming increasingly ‚Äústicky,‚Äù signaling a shift from speculative trading toward institutional-grade holding.

Fidelity is questioning the clean 4-year halving script most people still trade.

In past cycles, #Bitcoin topped about 17 to 18 months after each halving. That pattern worked in 2017. It worked again in 2021. So it‚Äôs easy to assume April 2024 started the same countdown.

ETF demand is constant and mechanical, not driven by retail euphoria. The U.S. policy backdrop is no longer openly anti-crypto. And $BTC is beginning to trade more like its own macro asset instead of just another risk-on trade tied to equities.

Those pieces didn‚Äôt exist in prior cycles.

Fidelity compares today to commodity supercycles in the early 2000s -- longer periods at elevated prices, fewer violent crashes, and demand that sticks around.

If that view is right, calling a ‚Äúpost-halving top‚Äù might be the wrong trade. Most people are still positioned for a cycle that may not repeat. üöÄ

NOW: Nigeria requires crypto transactions to be linked to Tax IDs and National IDs.  $BTC  #Altcoin Season#

$BTC regulatory shift in Nigeria effective January 1, 2026: Under the Nigeria Tax Administration Act (NTAA) 2025, the government is now tracking crypto activity through Tax Identification Numbers (TINs) and National Identification Numbers (NINs) without needing to monitor the blockchain directly.

How it works:

Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASPs) crypto exchanges, wallets, etc. must collect and link user transactions to TINs (and NINs where applicable).

Monthly reports to the Nigeria Revenue Service (NRS, formerly FIRS) include names, contacts, transaction details, values, dates, and counterparties.

Authorities match crypto flows against tax filings, income declarations, and records for compliance and enforcement.

Large/suspicious activity flagged to tax authorities and the Nigerian Financial Intelligence Unit (NFIU).

Records retained for 7+ years, with heavy penalties for non-compliance (up to ‚Ç¶10M initial fine with monthly penalties, license risks).

This identity-based approach sidesteps costly/complex blockchain analytics, focusing on the "reporting layer" instead. It aligns with the OECD's Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework (CARF) (also effective Jan 1, 2026) for global/cross-border transparency.

Why now? Nigeria processed ~$92.1B in crypto value (July 2024‚ÄìJune 2025) one of the world's highest  but earlier 2022 profit taxes faced low compliance due to anonymity. This closes the gap, boosts revenue, and formalizes the sector amid high adoption.

Impact for users: Expect more KYC demands, potential audits on unreported gains (taxed as income up to 25%), and less anonymity on regulated platforms. P2P/offshore might see shifts, but the message is clear crypto income is now firmly in the tax net.

MicroStrategy‚Äôs recent purchase represents its largest addition of $BTC  since July, drawing fresh attention to how major holders position themselves ahead of market moves. The timing has led some traders to ask whether Michael Saylor and his team are positioning ahead of a broader rally.  Large buys from an institution with a long track record in $BTC  can influence sentiment. When a significant purchaser enters the market, it often signals confidence in the asset‚Äôs medium-term outlook. In this case, the scale of the buy suggests that MicroStrategy expects favorable conditions for price appreciation.  However, buying ahead of a rally is different from predicting one. Bitcoin‚Äôs price still depends on broader factors such as macro liquidity, #ETF  flows and derivatives positioning. MicroStrategy‚Äôs purchase reduces available supply at current levels, but it does not guarantee that price will move higher immediately.  If other institutional players follow suit and spot demand increases, the conditions for a rally improve. A coordinated increase in demand from large holders, funds and retail buyers can push price upward. Until then, this buy is best seen as a strong vote of confidence rather than a definitive signal that the next leg up has begun.

$BTC  Bitcoin Dominance Chart: Why #Altcoin  Season Could Start Now  The histogram illustrates a classic cyclical pattern. Following each Bitcoin dominance peak (gray columns), a prolonged decline phase occurs‚Äîthese are precisely the "altcoin seasons."  Key Observations:  Cycle Regularity: Each market cycle (2017, 2021) reveals a similar pattern: a sharp rise in BTC dominance during the initial bull market stage, followed by a rapid capital outflow into altcoins.  Current Position (2024-2025): We are in a phase historically preceding a major "altcoin rally." BTC dominance, having reached a local high, shows signs of decline or consolidation (point "W" on the chart often signals a reversal).  Trend Support: Trend lines (e.g., "Y") indicate that the current dominance level is at a critical support line. Breaking this level has historically triggered a massive rotation from $BTC  to alts.  Why This Matters for an Investor Right Now?  BTC Accumulation is Complete: Institutions and large players have finished accumulating $BTC . Its further price appreciation does not require proportional growth in dominance.  The Hunt for Higher Yield: Capital taking profits in BTC seeks multiplication opportunities in more volatile assets with lower market capitalization.  Technical Signal: The chart is forming a pattern similar to past cycles. Point "X" often marks the zone where accelerated dominance decline begins.  Implications for 2025-2026:  The historical model reflected in the chart points to a high probability of a major "altcoin season" starting in the coming quarters. A decline in Bitcoin's share from ~55% to 30-40% levels (as in 2018 and 2021) would release trillions of dollars in capital into alternative crypto assets.  Action Point: This phase is the time for research and strategic positioning in fundamentally strong altcoins, especially within key narratives (AI, DePIN, DeFi). The chart is not a guarantee, but a powerful historical guide. Cycles repeat.

11 Years of the Lightning Network ‚Äî Pioneering the Internet of Money

2015: Lightning Network Whitepaper published by @jcp @tdryja 

2016: RGB whitepaper / early concepts proposed by @peterktodd and @giacomozucco 

2017: Liquid Whitepaper released by @Blockstream 

2018: Lightning Network mainnet launch by @lightning 

2018: Liquid mainnet launch

2021: Activation of the Taproot upgrade (BIP-341/342/343), laying the foundation for the Lightning Network‚Äôs multi-asset era.

2022: Taproot Assets Protocol (formerly TARO) proposal release

2023: Ordinal protocol launched on Bitcoin mainnet

2023: Taproot Assets launched on Bitcoin mainnet

2024: Runes protocol launched on Bitcoin mainnet

2024: Taproot Assets officially adds support for the Lightning Network

May 2025: Spark enters beta on mainnet

Jul 2025: RGB officially launches on mainnet

Oct 2025: Ark Labs announces Arkade entering public beta.

End of 2025: Lightning Network capacity surpasses a record 5,600 BTC, laying the foundation for trillions of dollars in liquidity.

What‚Äôs Next?
As the Lightning Network matures into its second decade, it stands at the threshold of becoming the backbone of a truly global, open, and resilient financial infrastructure. In a world increasingly shaped by geopolitical instability and monetary fragmentation, Bitcoin‚Äîand particularly stablecoins settled over Lightning‚Äîwill emerge as essential tools for households and businesses to preserve value and transact freely. With AI-driven payment rails, deep merchant adoption, and seamless interoperability between multi-asset protocols like Taproot Assets and RGB‚Äînot just on Bitcoin but across blockchains‚Äîthe network is poised to scale beyond billions to support trillions in transaction volume. Enabling this vision remains a key focus of Lnfi: building the financial primitives, liquidity layers, and institutional-grade infrastructure that empower the Internet of Money to serve everyone, everywhere. The next chapter isn‚Äôt just about capacity or speed; it‚Äôs about embedding sound money into the fabric of everyday digital life‚Äîopen, permissionless, and ready for the future.
